title: So Kat gets a hefty nerf due to being halfway decent now solely because of meta changes.
body: Meanwhile Lee Sin pretty much single-handedly defines a meta and has for years, and he barely gets touched. Sounds about accurate for Riot Game. I guess Kat just doesn't make #LCSBIGPLAYS.

On the plus side, maybe if scripters start using Lee Sin Riot will actually delete him. Wait who am I kidding, they'd probably buff him if that happened.
Too bad Lee Sin is not easy to use, and thus will probably never be scripted.
Kat has been underperforming in recent featured game modes. The only one where she was powerful was URF. Regardless, they specifically mentioned that they don't balance aroound FGMs.

Katarina has that "Fiora Effect" (a term I first heard used by Gbay99, but very relevant)

She does nothing but mass amounts of dps, she has no real source of cc, but this makes her perfect for carrying solo queue. If other people can do just a minor amount of cc, the fed, raw dps champs, can easily come in and clean house.

The problem is that snowballing is a mid-late game feature which is meant to share your feed with your team. You become unstoppable, and make sure you win every fight, so your team can then take objectives. The problem is in the application of snowballing, where you see people become unstoppable with no counterplay. A level 6 ultimate that can be used 3 times in one minute is stupidly strong. Even if you deny the full ultimate, it hemorrhages damage making it impossible to keep her pinned for long.

I honestly wish that players would think before they complain. You are comparing a champion (lee sin) who's only good at forcing a snowball on either himself or others in the early/mid game. To a champion meant to nuke people at all stages of the game post level 6. Their purposes are completely different and they should be treated as such.

Another player mentioned a 70% ban rate in Korea. A lot of people in the NA server think Ezreal sucks, but he is one of the safest and easiest marksmen to win bot lane with, and the Koreans can prove that one. Look at Korean stats before you complain. If they are winning 60% of the time or more with just one champion, it needs to be looked at to see if it is op, or the players have found some mechanic that makes it op.

The difference being the difficulty for playing as and against these champions. Lee Sin takes a good amount of skill to really utilize him to the point that he is too strong and he can be just as easily outplayed.

Katarina on the other hand, if she is big, you are dead.

> Or it could be that people haven't worked out the right counters to her yet, or that Riot has been steadily nerfing the things that counter her (silences, hard ccs) because they're "anti-fun", or that Riot has never actually done anything to address snowballing that isn't just nerfing numbers.

Apparently people forgot those counters since then. Also you seem to have missed that the comment about Lee Sin was that he *on his own* dictated the jungle for an entire season (arguably more) and has no real weaknesses, and next season's jungle is looking like a giant buff to him, while Kat has clear weaknesses, does literally one thing for a team, and has come back into play only because everyone else got nerfed. Yet only one of the two gets the nerf bat. Hint: It's the one that isn't one of Riot's favored champions.

Knee jerk nerfing Kat is stupid, but then stupid is the Riot's balance MO.

And no, im not gonna go play Dota, as i personally just dont enjoy that game as much as league, and I enjoy leagues aesthetics more, and find leagues champs more interesting.
